name: personalSite
title: This Website
subtitle: The portfolio you're looking at right now — made from scratch, no fancy libraries, just code and patience.

items.text: This website counts as a project — there’s actually quite a bit to it. It’s not just a static page with some links. There’s a small (but mighty) custom UI library, context-driven global state, and even dynamic routing and rendering for markdown-based article content fetched from another repo.
Every part of the layout is custom-built. Routing, themes, overlays, and data-driven rendering all work with minimal dependencies.

steps: You land on the site — it uses React Router to determine which content to show.
Article JSON is loaded from a separate repo and parsed.
Each section in the article uses a type-to-component renderer.
Global context provides dark mode, menu handling, and a nav stack for popups.
Everything is wrapped in a responsive layout, built using SCSS and media queries.

items.text: I used unDraw for the art (I’m not an artist, sorry!). The entire app is built with React, React Router, and my own layout logic — no MUI, no Tailwind, no Bootstrap. Just styled SCSS modules and logic. Oh, and there's a hefty TODO list hiding in the repo too.
